content.content: Tube feeding (enteral nutrition) is given when a patient[^187][^186]: - Can’t swallow or chew - Not absorbing nutrients in digestive system - Illness - Decreased appetite Infant and pediatric patients get tube feedings for[^188]: - Absent or weak sucking or swallowing reflex - Birth defects - Electrolyte imbalances - Elimination problems ## Feeding Tubes Feeding tubes are inserted to give the tube feeding (enteral nutrition). ### Types of feeding tubes[^189][^190]: - Nasogastric (NG) put through the nose into the stomach - Percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) put through the skin into the stomach - Jejunostomy (J-tube) put through the skin into the small bowel ### Risk factors before tube insertion[^191][^192]: - Altered mental status - Sedative or pain medications - Tracheostomy or endotracheostomy tube - Absent cough reflex - Anatomic abnormalities - ICU patient ### Risks when inserting feeding tubes[^191][^192][^193]: - Wrong tube placement into the lungs, esophagus or brain - Reaction to anesthesia - Pain - Leakage of stomach contents - Infection at tube insertion - Bleeding at tube insertion - Bleeding and/or infection in other organs in the body - Blockage of the tube - Tube moves out of the stomach or small bowel ### Ways to verify the tube is in the right place[^191][^192][^193][^194]: - X-ray for blind insertion of tube and for ETP (electromagnetic tube placement) - Measure pH of aspirate from tube - Capnography - Watch for signs of respiratory distress - Auscultation method (air bolus) is not accurate - Water bubbling method is not accurate - Measure aspirate volume moving from small bowel to stomach - Review chest and abdomen x-rays for tube moving ### Problems with feeding tubes[^191][^192][^193][^194]: - Tube feeding goes into the lungs (aspiration) - Clogging - Wrong connections to IVs or other catheters - Moves to esophagus or lung - Infections - Bleeding Embedded content: https://youtu.be/NBXw-IW5IOQ __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__ [The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form") [Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance") [Feeding Tube Information from Feeding Tube Awareness Foundation](http://www.feedingtubeawareness.org) [Nutritional Support Information from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/nutritionalsupport.html) [What is Enteral Nutrition? from the American Society of Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition](http://www.nutritioncare.org/About_Clinical_Nutrition/What_is_Enteral_Nutrition/) [Feeding Tubes-Infants from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/007235.htm) [Feeding Tube Insertion-Gastrostomy from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/002937.htm) [^186]: American Society for Parenteral & Enteral Nutrition.
